meanings.sent1: The crosshatched pattern on the tablecloth added a nice touch to the dining table.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a crosshatched technique to create depth in the drawing.
meanings.sent3: The crosshatched design on the wall made it look like a giant checkerboard.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a crosshatched maze of thoughts, each line leading to a different idea.
meanings.sent5: The crosshatched shadows from the window blinds danced on the floor, creating a mesmerizing effect.

meanings.definition: To mark or shade with intersecting lines
meanings.sent1: She carefully crosshatched the sketch to give it a more realistic look.
meanings.sent2: The architect crosshatched the blueprint to indicate different materials to be used.
meanings.sent3: He crosshatched the map so many times that it looked like a spider had walked all over it.
meanings.sent4: The chef crosshatched the pastry crust before baking to create a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The gardener crosshatched the soil before planting the seeds, ensuring proper aeration for the plants.
